tutorial.title: Jeans Shop
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use your knowledge of arrays to manage the stock of an online jeans shop

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use our knowledge of arrays to manage the stock of an online jeans shop.

The variables `s`, `m`, and `l` store the jeans in stock for each size. 

1. Create a `const` variable named `stock` set to an array holding the three variables in the order: `s`, `m`, and `l`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
A customer purchased a pair of jeans in size small (s). 

1. Access the first element of the `stock` array to update the stock of size small jeans. The text editor will mark your code in red (because we have not completed the syntax) but we will address this in the next lesson.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: The indices of an array start from 0.

executableContent.instructions:
Due to the purchase, we have one less item in size small (s). 

1. Decrease the value of `stock[0]` by one. You may use the subtraction operator or the subtraction assignment operator.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Another customer returned a pair of jeans in size medium (m). 

1. Like before, access the element in the array that represents size medium (m), and increase its value by one. You may use the operator of your choice.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Let's display our current inventory of jeans. 

1. Print the text "Current Stock" in the console.
2. On the next line, print `"s: "` followed by the value of the first element of the array. Your output should look like:

```
Current Stock
s: 19
```

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Concatenate a `string` with an array element using the addition `+` operator.

executableContent.instructions:
Below the stock for size small, display the stock for size medium (m) in the console. 

1. Like before, display `"m: "`, followed by the value of the second element of the array.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Finally, let's see how many jeans there are left in size large (l). 

1. Display `"l: "` and the last value of the array in the console.
